spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

action.name: Stone Quarterstaff Melee Weapon Attack
entries: {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, or 19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage if used two-handed.

Rock Ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit 10} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Earthen Fists (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The giant chooses a location within 20 feet, causing earthen fists to spring from the ground and pummel any targets in the area. Each creature other than the giant within 20 feet of the target must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Mystic Runes The giant possesses several mystic runes carved into its own body. The giant may activate one by running its hand over the rune, creating a one-time effect. After the effect has been activated, the rune magically fades from the giant's body. A typical stone giant runecarver has {@dice 1d4} such runes carved into its flesh, chosen from the list below:
Mystic Rune effects (choose or roll {@dice 1d6}):
Rune is equivalent to a 1st level spell scroll
Rune is equivalent to a 2nd level spell scroll
Rune is equivalent to a 3rd level spell scroll
Rune is equivalent to a 4th level spell scroll

Rune, when activated, causes a 20 foot radius area of ground centered within 30 feet of the giant to become difficult terrain. Typical effects are to turn the ground into mud or a stone slurry, or to make the ground extraordinarily rough and uneven.

Rune, when activated, causes a minor earthquake in a 30 foot radius, centered on a point within 30 feet of the giant. Any creature other than the giant within that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Rock Catching
entries: If a rock or similar object is hurled at the giant, the giant can, with a successful {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, catch the missile and take no bludgeoning damage from it.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
headerEntries: The yuan-ti's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}. {@hit 7} to hit with attack spells). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The yuan-ti is a 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The yuan-ti has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Chameleon Camouflage
entries: The yuan-ti can change the color and texture of its skin, giving it advantage on its Hide attempts.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Metamagic
entries: The yuan-ti has 10 sorcery points that it can spend to creature one of the following effects with spells cast with its spellcasting trait. The yuan-ti's regains all spent spell points after a long rest.

trait.name: Distant Spell
entries: The yuan-ti can spend one 1 sorcery point to range of a spell with a range of 5 feet or greater, or give a touch spell a range of 30 feet.

trait.name: Heightened Spell
entries: When the yuan-ti cast as spell that requires a saving throw, it can spend 3 sorcery points and give one target disadvantage on its first saving throw against that spell.

trait.name: Quickened Spell
entries: The yuan-ti can spend 2 sorcery points and use a bonus action to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action.

trait.name: Quick Coils
entries: When the yuan-ti has a target {@condition grappled}, it can make a constrict attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack (Yuan-ti Form Only)
entries: The yaun-ti makes two shortsword attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage and the target must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Shortsword (Yuan-ti Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target {@condition grappled} by the yuan-ti. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the yuan-ti can't constrict another target.

action.name: Venomous Tendrils (1/Day)
entries: The yuan-ti selects a point it can see within 90 feet of it. The area within a 20-foot radius of the point becomes magically filled with serpent-like tendrils. When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage and be {@condition restrained} by the tendrils. A creature that starts its turn in the area and is already {@condition restrained} by the tendrils takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. A {@condition restrained} creature can make additional Strength or Dexterity saving throws at the end of each of its turns, end the effect on itself on a success.
The area last for 1 minute, until it is dismissed by the yuan-ti with a bonus action, or until the yuan-ti loses concentration on the spell.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target {@condition grappled} by the yuan-ti. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the yuan-ti can't constrict another target.

entries: The yuan-ti selects a point it can see within 90 feet of it. The area within a 20-foot radius of the point becomes magically filled with serpent-like tendrils. When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage and be {@condition restrained} by the tendrils. A creature that starts its turn in the area and is already {@condition restrained} by the tendrils takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. A {@condition restrained} creature can make additional Strength or Dexterity saving throws at the end of each of its turns, end the effect on itself on a success.
The area last for 1 minute, until it is dismissed by the yuan-ti with a bonus action, or until the yuan-ti loses concentration on the spell.

reaction.name: Sentinel Strike
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the yuan-ti makes an attack against a target other than the yuan-ti, the yuan-ti can make a melee attack against the attacking creature.

headerEntries: The yuan-ti is a 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The yuan-ti has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

entries: When the yuan-ti hits a creature with a melee attack, the yuan-ti can choose to add 13 additional necrotic damage to the attack.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Quick Coils

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

trait.name: Sseth's Blessing
entries: The yuan-ti's weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d8} poison damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage and the target must make a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Shortsword (Yuan-ti Form Only)

Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the yuan-ti can't constrict another target.

action.name: Summon Serpents (1/Day)
entries: The magically summons {@dice 1d4} giant poisonous snakes. The summoned snakes appear in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of their summoner, act as an allies of their summoner, and follow its commands. The snakes remain until they or their summoner dies, or until the summoner dismisses them as a bonus action.

trait.name: Savings Throws Str +8, Dex +5, Con +6
entries: Skills Athletics +8 Stealth +5
Damage Resistances acid
Senses darkvision 90 ft., passive Perception 11
Languages -- Challenge 8 (3,900 XP)

trait.name: Dragon Ancestry (Elite Trait, recharges after a short or long rest)
entries: If the dracolisk is reduced to 0 hit points, it doesn't die or fall {@condition unconscious}. Instead, all conditions and effects it is suffering end for it, it regains 100 hit points, all of its abilities recharge, and it can immediately use an elite action.

trait.name: Limited Magic Resistance
entries: The basilisk has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects that are 3rd level or lower.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The basilisk's weapon attacks are considered magical for overcoming resistances.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 ft. of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw if the basilisk isn't Incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is Restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, it is no longer {@condition restrained} or petrifying, but it gains one level of {@condition exhaustion} that last for 1 minute. On a failure, the creature is Petrified until freed by the Greater Restoration spell or other magic.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 ft. of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

trait.name: Relentless
entries: If the basilisk has advantage on saving throws against effects that inflict the {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition restrained}, or {@condition stunned} condition.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The basilisk can make three attacks: two claw attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Acid Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The basilisk exhales acid in a 40-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
ELITE ACTIONS
Once the dracolisk's elite trait is activated it can take an elite action, choosing from the options below, on its initiative count +10, or in place of one of its standard actions on its turn.

action.name: Wing Attack
entries: The basilisk beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The basilisk can then fly up to half its flying speed.

action.name: Darkness
entries: The basilisk conjures magical darkness that spreads from a point the basilisk chooses within 60 feet of it, filling a 15-foot-radius sphere for 1 minute or until the basilisk dismisses it as a bonus action or dies. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision, except the basilisk, can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it. If any of the effect's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.
